intro: Scabiosa triandra var. mollis, commonly known as the soft scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and fern-like, serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its nectar-rich flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
